channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Australian PGA Championships
item.description:
Sunday, November 27, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support Australian PGA Championships.

The PGA of Australia is a not-for-profit Member-based organisation representing both Tournament Professionals and the Club Professionals who form the cornerstone of the industry, working in golf facilities throughout Australia and overseas. PGA Members play an integral role in servicing more than 1.2 million Australians who hit the fairways each year. The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA’s flagship event. One of the feature events on the ISPS HANDA PGA Tour of Australasia, the time-honoured tournament will be played in Brisbane for the second time this year. Some of the world’s best golfers are expected to converge on the event and will compete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup – Australian professional golf’s oldest trophy.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Monday, November 28, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2022 World AIDS Day
item.description:
Thursday, December 1, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support 2022 World AIDS Day.

QPP coordinates the annual World AIDS Day awareness campaign in Queensland, with support from Queensland Health and the National Department of Health and Aged Care. Since 1988, World AIDS Day has been held globally on 1 December. It is a day for the community to show their support for people living with HIV and to commemorate people who have died of AIDS related conditions. Its focus is to raise awareness across the world and in the community about HIV and AIDS, reduce HIV stigma, and promote prevention options, and access to treatment and support.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

Its focus is to raise awareness across the world and in the community about HIV and AIDS, reduce HIV stigma, and promote prevention options, and access to treatment and support.
This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People

item.title: Imagine What is Possible Ball
item.description:
Thursday, December 1, 2022

The City Hall will be lit Purple to support Imagine What is Possible Ball.

Endeavour Foundation is an independent, for purpose organisation established in 1951 with a vision to support people with an intellectual disability to live their best life starting with equal access to education and life-skills learning. 

In 2021 we celebrated out 70th anniversary, and held the Imagine What's Possible competition. One of those entries was from Kassidy Skinner, a Brisbane local and person with disability, whose wish was to host a ball for all for all people with disability to connect, dance, and dine at one of Brisbane's most accessible venue - Brisbane Town Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Endeavour Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

The City Hall will be lit Red and Green to support Christmas lighting.

item.title: Disability Action Week
item.description:
Friday, December 2, 2022

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support Disability Action Week.

Sporting Wheelies & Disabled Association are the leading provider of inclusive sports, recreation, and rehabilitation therapy in Queensland. As the state’s peak body for Paralympic sports, we are committed to making active goals of all levels accessible for people with a disability. With the 2032 Brisbane Paralympics on its way, we are very excited to make our presence known to the broader community.

26/11 to 2/12 is Disability Action Week with the festivities ending on 3/12 for International Day of People with Disability. Through our organisation, we want to challenge the way people think about disability and help grow a more inclusive Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Sporting Wheelies and Disabled Association

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: International Day of People with Disability
item.description:
Saturday, December 3, 2022

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support International Day of People with Disability.

International Day of People with Disability is held on 3 December each year, and is a United Nations observed day aimed at increasing public awareness, understanding and acceptance of people with disability.
It's a day to celebrate the achievements and contributions of people with disability. This year’s theme, ‘Seeing the ability in disability’, challenges perceptions and common stereotypes, and celebrates the achievements of Australians living with disability.

We can work together to see all abilities and create an inclusive Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: 75 years of Lions Service to the Community
item.description:
Sunday, December 4, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple & Yellow to support 75 years of Lions Service to the Community.

Lions Australia has grown to be the largest service club organisation in Australia, with a proud history of community service and commitment to improving the lives of others. We pride ourselves on the work we do to make our communities better places to live, and on doing our bit to nurture our local, national and global environments. The first Lions Club in Australia chartered in September 1947.  Recognition of the past 75 years of service to the community by Lions in the Queensland Districts of 201Q1 and 201Q3.

This Light Up is organised by: Lions Club International District 201Q1

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, December 4, 2022

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.
This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

item.title: Christmas in Brisbane
item.description:
Friday, December 9, 2022

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and Green to support Christmas in Brisbane.

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family. Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by South Bank Parklands for music, Christmas movies under the stars, markets and many more activities. Find out what Brisbane has on offer this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
